title: TypeScript Essentials: From Zero to Hero
author: Michael Brown

content.introduction: TypeScript adds static typing to JavaScript, making your code more robust and maintainable. Learn how to leverage TypeScript in your projects.

sections.title: 1. Basic Types and Interfaces
sections.content: Understand TypeScript's type system, including basic types, interfaces, and type aliases. Learn how to define clear contracts for your code.

sections.title: 2. Classes and Inheritance
sections.content: Explore object-oriented programming in TypeScript, including classes, inheritance, and access modifiers.

sections.title: 3. Generics
sections.content: Master generic types to create flexible, reusable components and functions that work with multiple data types.

sections.title: 4. Advanced Types
sections.content: Dive into union types, intersection types, mapped types, and conditional types for advanced type manipulation.

content.conclusion: TypeScript is an invaluable tool for building scalable applications. With these concepts mastered, you'll write safer, more maintainable code.
